metadata.title: CVE-2024-39485 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:media: v4l: async: Properly re-initialise notifier entry in unregisterThe notifier_entry of a notifier is not re-initialised after unregisteringthe notifier. This leads to dangling pointers being left there so uselist_del_init() to return the notifier_entry an empty list.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-39485` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
